name: Abbot's Book Demo
description: A trailer for the 8-episode narrative VR The Abbot's Book.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: i7 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia 970, AMD rx480

reviews.review_text: A chilling glimpse into the upcoming eight-part Abbot's Book. I loved the eerie atmosphere and attention to detail. Although the demo is very short, I spent longer just admiring the environment as I explored the dark ruins by the light of a torch. Spooky, with a brooding gothic tone. I can't wait to see more!

Spooky and the priest that follows you around has this lifelike quality where I found myself wanting to talk to him. VR is still new and I look forward to better graphics in games like this. As it stands, very atmospheric.

+ Architecture looks dark / scary / realistic + NPCs look weird / strange / disturbing + / - Very constricting navigation system + / - Not very interactive, except look around / listen to dialog - Player talks, with simple dialog choices - Story seems bland / unintersting - No hand models (just Vive controllers)  It's a short demo, but one that makes me want a bigger play area. Inside the catacombs, I tried my hardest to walk through every bit. The experience of having a torch in hand and walking in a dark gothic setting is awesome. I prefer a silent protaganist though. Having someone talk for me, expecailly in VR, disconnects me from the moment.
wow, awesome atmosphere. The design of the catacombs is freakin epic. LOVE IT
Wow the part when you enter an open cave is amazing, the cave is absolutely massive!
Could be cool. The plot is compeling, the voice acting good, and the layout/design of the play area are varied.  Not sure if this genre is for me.
Nice atmospheric demo. You decend into a cave with a torch in your hand. Really good graphics and effects. Some little suprises.  Looking forward for more of this.

Superb dark atmosphere and graphics. An interesting look-at-defined-spots movement mechanic, took me a bit to get used to in comparison to the free-teleporters like Vanishing Realms, but then works ok with this type of game. Also, no jump scares so far for me, which is a plus. You may nope out once zombie Gollum heads for you though...
This has potential. I'm undecided at the moment as to whether I'll purchase.
